oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Abstract of purchases made on account of subsistence of the army
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Armies -- Commissariat; Operational rations (Military supplies)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Abstract of purchases of fresh beef acquired for the Confederate Army by B. J. Semmes, A. C. S., for the third quarter 1863. It lists the date of purchase, the voucher number, the names of the 18 individuals from whom the beef was bought, the amounts, and the cost. A total 13,100 pounds of beef was purchased for $3,230.00. Abstract includes a statement that the amounts listed were paid as charged and bought at lowest market price.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- Army -- Subsistence Bureau
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Quartermaster of the Army provides logistical support to the combat troops in the form of ammunition, clothing, food, and pay. A. C. S. stands for "Assistant Commissary of Subsistence," who is an officer responsible for provisioning the army.
